intro: Siphocampylus planchonis var. daweanus, commonly known as the Daweanus siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
